titleStmt.title: Sayfa śǝllāse, Malkǝʾa śǝllāse, Naʿā ḫabeya ʾo-ʾǝgziʾǝya ʾIyasus, Hymns

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.incipit:
በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ በቅድስት፡ ሥላሴ፡ እንዘ፡ አአምን፡ ወእትመሐፀን፡ እክህደከ፡ ሰይጣን፡ በቅድመ፡ ዛቲ፡ እምየ፡ ቅድስት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ስምዕየ፡ ማርያም፡ ጽዮን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። ተማኅፀንኡ፡ ብክሙ፡ አ
ነ፡ ገብርክሙ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡
msItem.explicit:
ተማኅፀንኩ፡ በሥጋሁ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወበደሙ፡ ክቡር፡ በዘ
ወሀቦ፡ ለሰብእ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ አውገዝኩ፡ ወኃተምኩ፡ እለ፡ ይገብሩ፡ ሥራየ፡ ወኃይለ፡ ጸላዒ፡ ወእምሰብእ፡ እምማኤ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይቅረቡ፡ ኀቤየ፡ ወኀበ፡ ቤትየ፡ ወሰብእየ፡ ወእንስሳየ፡ ሊተ፡ ለገብርከ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወለጸሐፊሁ፡ ገብረ፡ ፡ ማርያም ።ዘነብ።

msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እነቅሕ፡ በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ። እትነሣእ፡ በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አአትብ፡ ገጽየ፡ በትእምርተ፡ መስቀል፡
msItem.explicit:
በከመ፡ ባረከ፡ ያዕቆብሃ፡ ወደቂቆ፡ ለከ፡ ስብሐ
ት፡ ወአኰቴት፡ ወኃይል፡ ወመንግሥት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ዕቀቡኒ፡ ለገብርክሙ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡

msItem.incipit: አአትብ፡ ገጽየ፡ በመለኮተ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አአትብ፡ ፍጽምየ፡ በመለኮተ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አኃትም፡ ከዋልየ፡ በመለኮተ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አኃትም፡ የማንየ፡ በመለኮተ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አኃትም፡ ፀጋምየ፡ በመለኮተ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡
msItem.explicit:
ወኢለዜንዎ፡ ዕመቀ፡ ህላዌሆሙ፡ ብሑታነ፡ ሕሉና፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ጥንት፡ በሥላሴሆሙ፡ እንበለ፡ ፍልጠት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ ሀላውያን፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ጥንት፡ ወኢተፍጻሜት፡ በሥላሴሆሙ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ፍልየት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ ወአ፡ ለይኵ፡ ለይ። በዝቃልክሙ፡ ዕቀቡኒ፡ እመከራ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ለገብርክሙ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡

msItem.incipit: አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኅቡራነ፡ ህላዌ፡ በ፩መንበር። ህላዌ፡ አብ፡ ኢይትሌለይ፡ እምህላዌ፡ ወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ። ህላዌ፡ ወልድ፡ ኢይትፈለጥ፡ እምህላዌ፡ አብ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ።
msItem.explicit:
ግዕዘ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩ምስለ፡ አብ፡ ወምስለ፡ ወልድ። በዝንቱ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ኅቡር፡ ተማኅፀንኩ፡ ወአማኅፀንኩ፡ ነፍስየ፡ ወሥጋየ፡ ከመ፡ ይምሐረኒ፡ ወይሣሃለኒ፡ በእንተ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሥላሴሁ፡ ሊተ፡ ገብሩ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይ፡ ለ።

msItem.incipit: አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በግፃዌ፡ ሥሉስ፡ በሥላሴ፡ ግጽው፡ ዋህድ፡ አምላክ፡ ፫አዕማደ፡ ብርሃን፡ ፩አምጣኖሙ፡ ወ፩ስኖሙ፡ ፫መባርቅት፡
msItem.explicit:
በዝንቱ፡ ስመ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ተማኅፀንኩ፡ ከመ፡ ይክፍለኒ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እምተስፋ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እንተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደብተራ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ጽዮን፡ ሊተ፡ ገብርከ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡

msItem.incipit: ዓይ፡ ልሳን፡ ወዓይ፡ ከናፍር፡ ዘይክል፡ ነቢበ፡ ዕበየ፡ ክብሩ፡ ለሥላሴ፡ ዓይ፡ ልቡና፡ ወዓይ፡ ሰሚዕ፡ ዘይክል፡ አእሜሮ፡ ህላዌሆሙ፡ ለሥላሴ።
msItem.explicit:
ስብሐ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ሰብእ፡ ወመላእክት፡
ኢየአምርዎ፡ ለምክሩ፡ ወለምሥጢሩ። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወአሜን፡ ለይኵን፡ ለይኩን። ዕቀበኒ፡ ወአድኅነኒ፡ እመከራ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ሊተ፡ ለገብርከ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡ወለጸሐፊሁ፡ ገብረ፡
ማርያም

msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለፍቅረ፡ መለኮት፡ በትስብእቱ፡ ዘጸመ። እንበይነ፡ ዚአነ፡ አርአያሁ፡ ከመ፡ የሀበነ። ሰላም፡ ለፍ ቅረ፡ መለኮት፡ ዘይፄዓን፡ ላዕለ፡ ሠረገላ፡ ኪሩቤል፡ በትስብእቱ፡ ተፅዕነ፡ ዲበ፡ ዕዋል።
msItem.explicit: ስብሐት፡ ለ ሥላሴ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ምሉዕ፡ በኵለሄ፡ ለ ሥላሴ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስባሔ፡ እዉድ፡ በሱራኄ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወአሜን፡ ለይኵን፡ ለይኩን።

msItem.incipit: አኃሥሥ፡ ጽድቀ፡ እምኀቤከ፡ ኦቀመረ፡ ጽድቅ። አኃሥሥ፡ ጥበበ፡ እምኀቤከ፡ ኦሙዳየ፡ ጥብብ። ኦሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡
msItem.explicit:
ዛቲ፡ ክርታስ፡ ሲሳይ፡ መንፈሳዊት፡ ለዘቦ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ በደኃሪት፡ ዕለት፡ ት
ባልሕ፡ እሞት፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን። ወአድኅነኒ፡ ወባልሐኒ፡ ሊተ፡ ለኃጥእ፡ ሊተ፡ ገብርከ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡ወለጸሐፊሁ፡ መሐሮ፡ ወዕቀቦ፡ ለገብርከ፡ ገብረ፡
ወለወልደ፡ ሚካኤልኒ፡ ዕቀቦ፡ ወአድኅኖ።

msItem.note: The hymnodic portrait poem praises the Trinity and comprises 47 strophes.
msItem.incipit: ሰላም፡ ለህላዌክሙ፡ ዘይመውዕ፡ ህላዌያተ። ለረኪበ፡ ስሙ፡ ኅቡዕ፡ አመ፡ ወጠንኩ፡ ተምኔተ። እምግ ብርክሙ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ሶበ፡ ረከቡ፡ አስማተ። መለኮተ፡ ለለ፩ዘዚአክሙ፡ ገጻተ። እንበለ፡ ትድምርት፡ እሰሚ፡ ወእሁብ፡ ትድምርተ። ሰላም፡ ለዝክረ፡ ስምክሙ፡ ዘኢትጋባዕ፡ እምተከፍሎ።
msItem.explicit:
ለዘበነጊድ፡ አቅረብኩ፡ መካልየ፡ ልሳን፡ ስብሐታተ። መጠነ፡ ራብዕ፡ አሥር፡ እንዘ፡ አተሉ፡ ፯ተ። ህየንተ፡ ፩ሥላሴ፡ እለ፡ ትፈድዩ፡ ፻ተ። ጸግወኒ፡
ለገብርክሙ፡ ንዋየ፡ ገጽ፡ ትፍሥሕተ። ወዲበ፡ ፲አኅጉር፡
ሀቡኒ፡ ሢመተ። ለገብርክሙ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡
መልዓ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በላዕለ፡
ገብረ፡
ማርያም፡

msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሥሉስ፡ ኅፀተ፡ ግፃዌ፡ ዘአልቦ። ሰቆቃወ፡ ድንግል፡ እጽሐፍ፡ በቀለመ፡ ዓንብዕ፡ ወአንጠብጥቦ። ወይሌ፡ ወላህ፡ ለይበል፡ ለዘንበቦ። ከማሃ፡ ኃዘን፡ ወተሰዶ፡ ኀበ፡ በኵለሄ፡ ረኪቦ። ርእዮ፡ ለይብኪ፡ ዓይነ፡ ልበ፡ ዘቦ።
msItem.explicit:
ሶበ፡ሐይለይኩ፡ ፍልሰትየ፡ ርኁቅ፡ ብሔረ። ወሑረትየ፡ እምዝ፡ ኀበ፡ ኢይገብዕ፡ ድኅረ። ብካየ፡ ንግደትኪ፡ ድንግል፡ ኮነኒ፡ መዝሙረ። ረሰይኒ፡ ወትረ፡ ማርያም፡
ውስተ፡ አፉኪ፡ ዝኩረ። በሕሊናኪ፡ ህልወ፡ ወበልብኪ፡ ኅዱረ። እስመ፡ ዘእንበሌኪ፡ ባዕደ፡ አልብየ፡ ማዕምረ። ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ዕቀብኒ፡ እመከራ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ሊተ፡ ለገብርኪ፡
ገብረ፡

extent.note: Data on leaves dimensions taken from .

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in pencil in the upper right corner.

collation.signatures: Quire marks are written in the upper inner corner of the recto of the first leaf of each quire with black ink. Quires 1 (), 11 () and 12 () have no marking. Number ፰ on () was added later, still by the main hand.

list.item: 3 3, stub before 3 The leaves of quire A () are loose.

supportDesc.condition: Head and tailband are missing (tiedowns are visible in the centrefolds of all quires). A rectangular piece is cut out from at the bottom. All edges were trimmed. Occasionally smuged ink, e.g. on

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
layout.ab: Ruling is visible; pricking is visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
layout.ab: Ruling is visible; pricking is visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The ruling pattern is clearly different on : three ruled lines above, three lines in the middle, and three lines below. The same pattern, barely visible, is probably ruled on .

handNote.desc: Trained hand. The handwriting appears regular with broadly spaced characters. The name of the scribe was erased in all supplication formulars he had didicated to himself ( ), only the first part of his name ገብረ is preserved.He is also the main scribe of .
handNote.seg: Rubricated are several groups of lines on the incipit page of and of all its sections, as well as of , regularly two lines of subsections of and on the incipit page of . Holy names (names of the members of the Trinity are written alternating with red and black on ), names of saints and holy creatures, names of persons related to the production of the manuscript (almost all deleted), elements of the punctuation marks, text dividers and of numerals are written in red thoughout the manuscript. Different particular elements are rubricated in the various texts: name of the letters (), the word ሰላም or its first character ሰ and its abbreviated form (), the words እኵት () and ስብሐት or its abbreviated forms (), first word of each verse in

handNote.desc: Poor handwriting. Unexperienced scribe who tends to scribal errors and to a rushed scribt.

item.desc: The text stops in the middle of a word on the bottom of .

q.seg: ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጸባዖት፡ ፍጹም፡ ምሉእ፡ ሰማያተ፡ ወምድረ፡ ቅዱሳተ፡ ስብሐቲከ። እሰግድ፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ እንዘ፡ ፫ቱ፡ ፩ዱ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ፩ዱ፡ ፫ቱ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘይሴለሱ፡ በአካላት፡

item.desc: Aids for identifying weekday readings are written in the upper margin on the incipit page of a each section of in red ink (the scribe used a differnt nib for the reading references than for the main text): ዘሰኑይ () ዘሠሉስ (), ዘረቡዕ (), ዘሐሙስ (), ዘዓርብ (), ዘቀዳሚት (), ዘዘወትር (, in black), ዘእኁድ ()

Scribal corrections occur occasionally over erasure (e.g. here comprising several lines) or interlineally (e.g. ), also made in a secondary hand (e.g. ). Spaces (after erasure) were filled with an interlaced band on and with several thin lines on . The scribe wrote the last two lines of in small script in order to complete this section on the same folio . Writing exercises were executed on and upside down on . The name is written on (the rest of the entire folium is blank).

A turquoise and gold label of the textile trading company A.H. Huschke & Co with a leaping horse is sewn onto . The India-based company was active in the 19th century until its founder, August Henry Huschke of Swiss-German family background died in 1866 and his company was sold. A.H. Huschke & Co acquired a high ‘reputation for luxury cottons’ and other ‘quality goods for the fashion market’

item.q:
A Ramsbottom
82nd Rgt.
Looted at Maqdala 13th Apl 1868
Book of prayers and praises inscribed with the name of one Gabra Maryam. .
item.desc: The pencil note was written by .

A white sticker, with the name of (ቤንት፡ ዩውል፡ የንሰን።) printed on it, and the signatures ‘Ms. Aeth. f. 29’ written in pencil, is respectively glued on and on . Other two stickers with the signature ‘Ms 19’ printed on them are glued on .

binding.decoNote: Twowooden boards covered with tooled reddish brown tooled . A niche for a mirror is carved into the inner side of the front board (the mirror is lost, but traces of adhesive are still visible). The inner side of the back board is decorated with a silk inlay (coloured gold, blue, and red).
Blind-tooling decoration on the full leather cover including turn-ins, edges, and spine. The decoration was carefully applied using different tools.
The stitches of four endband chains are sewn into the leather of the spine, two being close to the head and two to the tail.
Coloured leaf string markers are inserted in the outer margin of folia to indicate the incipit pages of the sections of and the incipit pages of (on ).

provenance.p: The manuscript was produced by the same scribe who manufactured which belongs to the church of in , Tǝgrāy and was reasonably dated to 1841–1861.

Both codices share, beside the identical handwriting, particular scribal practices. They show similar elements for the visual organisation: an almost identical ornamental band on the incipit page of the first text (more elaborated in ; in other reserved spaces for ornamental bands do exist but were not filled) and a very similar way of rubricating the incipit pages of texts and their sections (at the top: two red lines followed by two black and another two red lines; at the bottom: two red lines and two black lines). The name of the patron or scribe or owner, originally written in red ink throughout both manuscripts, was deleted. A rather weak evidence in (see, e.g. ) points to the name of ገብረ፡ ማርያም (in this case, this original name was replaced in with one and the same name, see below).

However, in addition to the attested similar scribal practices, both codices share also physical peculiarities. Both have a quite particular book format which is rather narrow and long (more pronounced in ). Each cover shows a fine and careful tooled decoration. Both have threads inserted into folia or in also marks painted in red to indicate the incipit page of a text or of a section. Extremely striking are two labels of two textile companies, one is glued into the inner part of the front board in and the other is sewn onto in (see ). shows the label of “W&I Peel”, the (later) company of the successful textile industrialist Robert Peel (1723–1795), widely known as
(the label displays the Peel arms including a shuttle held by a lion, below a bee and the family motto 'Industria'; it is the same as provided in Wikipedia (, accessed on 25 May 2020). Both labels are related most probably to the silk or cotton inlays in both manuscripts and .

Coming back to : The name of the original patron or donor (introduced as ገበርከ ‘your servant’) is erased from the supplication formulas throughout the manuscript. Only the first part of his name ገብረ survived. His name was replaced by that of . The name of written by the main hand is mentioned only once, on .

The manuscript must have come into the possession of the church of Maqdala Madḫāne ʾĀlam at a certain time in its history from where it was looted on 13 April 1868 (see ) and brought to England. It is unknown how and when the manuscript came into the possession of .

revisionDesc.change: Full description of the Ms completed
